result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin Latrance Hobbs Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Court finds the State has complied with victim notification. AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to negotiations, Count 2 will be dismissed but read in for sentencing.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor, ammunition and/or explosives.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.   Neither the State nor Defense requests a Presentence Investigation Report.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Br 45.  mn

Defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Calvin Latrance Hobbs Jr. Assistant District Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury Instructions 1218A, 1479, Filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, Filed.

Defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs Jr. not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Calvin Latrance Hobbs Jr.  Defendant's appearance waived. Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense in resolution posture and requested plea hearing date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 45. Plea hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF

Defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will not hire private counsel so attorney Copeland will remain counsel of record, motion to withdraw, withdrawn.  There is further ongoing investigation by the State.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a status. Defense filed a motion to withdraw at the request of the defendant. Arguments heard. Defendant advised the court that Annette Rauch may take over the case as counsel. Defense motion is taken under advisement. Attorney Copeland to remain as counsel until there is an update on the status of new counsel. Case remains calendared in Br. 34.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel of Record, filed.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs not in court, in custody, Waukesha County Jail.  Kathryn Ginsberg for Sam Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs not in court, in custody, Waukesha County Jail.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via Zoom.  Discovery under review.  Adjourned to allow for new ADA to review.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Judge out ill. Atty Copeland via Zoom.  Discovery under review, awaiting offer.  Status rescheduled to May 13, 2022, 9am via Zoom.  kmw

Defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Michael Valuch - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, br 34.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of maximum penalties and right to counsel.  Complaint given to defendant's attorney who waived its reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Arguments as to bail.  Preliminary hearing April 4, 2022, 1:30PM.  kmw

Defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs in custody.  Elizabeth A Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.
br 34 in jury trial.  Matter rescheduled to April 4, 2022, 8;30 room 502SB.  kmw

Defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs not in court, defendant in custody, in CJF from Waukesha CountyJail. Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court.  Emily Zimmel for Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Per WFU request for extension, return on doctor report rescheduled; state to file OTP.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
WFU extension request.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Calvin Latrance Hobbs not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defendant refusing to appear.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. Court orders proceedings suspended. Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department, and ordered to be returned to Waukesha County.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
